events.text: I already found the gift card, nothing left down there but but lint and leftovers.

I got down on my hands and knees. Thoroughbred's blood, and bits of his dinner, had been soaked and stepped into it. That's when I saw something I recognized, lying among the paperwork.
A gift card to the Las Borpas Liquor Store that my wife got me for my birthday last week. God, she was so thoughtful, and actually real. I didn't deserve her.
It had been in my coat pocket, but when I got to the liquor store the night before, it wasn't there, and I just paid in cash. But if somebody started asking around... well, it could put them on my trail.
And that would be a goddamn stupid way to get caught.
I tucked it into my wallet, delicately. I was going to buy a thirty dollar bottle of whiskey with that one.

events.choice: LEAVE IT AND DON'T DISTURB THE SCENE

events.text: No way, Jose. My wife got that for me. I'm getting something halfway decent with this.
